definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Ps 75:9 wine (NH id.; Eth. wayon:: vitis, vinea, vinum; Ar. waynun (black) grapes, v. Hom:ZMG 1889, 654; Sab. [[וין]] vineyard, Mordt:ZMG 1887, 364 Hom:l. c. 659 (both after Glaser); As. inu in vocabularies, but this loan-word from western Shemites, acc. to Hom:Aufsätze 102; Jen:ZA i, 186 f., ZMG 1890, 705 argues to the contrary)—abs. [[יַ֫יִן]] Ge 9:21 + 84 t.; [[יׇ֑יִן]] Ge 14:18 + 33 t.; cstr. [[יַ֫יִן]] Ps 60:5, Ct So 8:2; [[יֵין]] De 32:18 + 9 t.; sf. [[יֵינִי]] Ct So 5:1, etc.;—wine:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: common drink, for refreshment Ge 14:18 (E?) Ge 27:25 (J), Ju Jdg 19:19, 2Sa 16:2, Am 5:11, Am 9:14, Ho 14:8, Job 1:13, Job 1:18, Da 1:5 +, tonic Pr 31:6; art. of commerce Ez Eze 27:18, Ne 13:15; among supplies in strongholds 2Ch 11:11; as making merry 2Sa 13:28, Zec 9:15, Zec 10:7, Es 1:10, Ec 9:7, Ec 10:19, Ps 104:15. †

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: used for rejoicing before ´[[י]] De 14:26, cf. Ho 9:4; as drink-offering in prescribed ritual Ex 29:40, Le 23:13, Nu 15:5, Nu 15:7, Nu 15:10, Nu 28:14; among temple stores 1Ch 9:29; used also in heathen ceremonial, v. De 32:33.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: intoxicating 1Sa 1:14, 1Sa 25:37, Ge 9:21, Ge 9:24, Ge 19:32, Ge 19:33, Ge 19:34, Ge 19:35 (all J), Is 5:11, Is 5:22, Pr 21:17, Pr 23:30, Pr 23:31 + ; ‖[[תִּירוֹשׁ]] Ho 4:11; ‖[[שֵׁלָר]] 1Sa 1:15, Mic 2:11, Is 24:9, Is 28:7, Is 28:7, Is 56:12 + 12 t.; forbidden to Nazirites † Nu 6:3, Nu 6:3 ([[חׂמֶץ יַיִן וְחׂמֶץ שֵׁכָר]]), v:Nu 6:4, v:Nu 6:20, cf. Am 2:12; to Rechabites † Je 35:2, Je 35:5 f.; to mother of Samson † Ju Jdg 13:4, Jdg 13:7, Jdg 13:14; to priests entering sanctuary † Le 10:9 (P), Ez Eze 44:21; unfitting for kings Pr 31:4. †

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: combinations are: [[יֵין הַטּוֹב]] Ct So 7:10 = the best wine (rd. [[כַּיַּיִן]] ?) Ges:§ 133. 3, R. 1; [[יֵין מַלְכוּת]] Es 1:7 royal wine; [[אׁחרְוֹת יַּיִן]] 1Ch 27:27 stores of wine, wine-supply; [[יַיִן הָרֶקַח]] Ct So 8:2 spiced wine; [[מִשְׁתֵּה הַיַּיִן]] wine-feast Es 5:6, Es 7:2, Es 7:7, Es 7:8; [[סׂבְאֵי יַיִן]] Pr 23:20 wine-bibbers; [[כאׁד יין]] wine-skin Jos 9:4, Jos 9:13, 1Sa 16:20; [[נֵבֶל יין]] id. 1Sa 1:24, 1Sa 10:3, 1Sa 25:18, 2Sa 16:1, Je 13:12, Je 13:12; [[בֵּית הַיׇּ֑יִן]] Ct So 2:4 either wine-house, where wine is drunk, feasting-house (De al.), or place of wine = vineyard (Ew al.; cf. [[גֶּפֶן יַיִן]] Nu 6:4). †

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: metaph. of wisdom's drink Pr 9:2, Pr 9:5, cf. Is 55:1; of ´[[י]]'s wrath Je 25:15 ([[כּוֹס היין]]); of confusion sent by ´[[י]], [[יַיִן תַּרְעֵלָה]] wine of reeling Ps 60:5, cf. Ps 75:9; of ´[[י]]'s awaking for vengeance, like a wine-shouter Ps 78:65; of Babylon's fierce power Je 51:7; of love Ct So 5:1; [[יֵין חֲמָסִים]] Pr 4:17; in sim. of one bursting with words Job 32:19; of disheartened proph. Je 23:9 ([[כְּגֶבֶר עֲבָרוֹיַיִן]]); of lover's mouth Ct So 7:10 (v. supr.); love is better than wine Ct So 1:2, So 4:10.
